section.title: Export and Version
section.para: Knowledge users with Content Manager or Administrator roles can create versions or export content by accessing this functionality from the Task Pane, see ; Editors can export content only and access this functionality from the Shortcuts menu, . The primary purpose of creating versions is to make releases and content available to internal and external customers in release file format. Currently Knowledge supports the generation of a SNOMED CT Release File Format 2 (RF2) release files.

section.title: Export with Editor Role
section.subtitle: With Editor Role
section.para: To create an export with Editor role select Export under the Shortcuts menu, and provide the parameters specified in the Export Form, :

listitem.para: Select modules - Select the modules that you want to export from. The edit module is selected by default. Select more than one module by holding the CTRL key while selecting multiple modules.
Content range - Select the date range for the content you are exporting. Note that when the files are exported, the content's date stamp will be updated to the selected start date.

Generate SCTID for content with missing IDs - Select this option when SCTIDs should be added to any newly created SNOMED CT concepts that do not have SCTIDs. Include the namespace identifier provided by SNOMED international when this option is selected.
Export type - SNOMED CT RF2 is selected by default. The Solor RF2 compatible release will be available in a future Knowledge release.

mediaobject.alt: Create an Export modal displays a form with the following information: select modules, content range, generate SCTIDs, namespace, export type, and buttons Create and Cancel.

section.para:
When an export is initiated a message is shown informing the user that an export is in process, see . Once the export is ready, Knowledge will notify you that the file is ready for download. Click on the export message, and your browser will prompt you to download the file to your computer. The download is made available for 5 mins and then expires, see . Export
Create an Export modal displays a form with the following information: select modules, content range, generate SCTIDs, namespace, export type, and buttons Create and Cancel.
Export Expired
Message displayed when export file has timed out. Time out is 5 mins.

section.title: Create a Version and Export
section.subtitle: With Administrator or Content Manager Role
section.para: If the user has the role of Administrator or Content Manager the Version and Export tab in the Task Pane is displayed. The Version and Export tab allows the user to create a version or initiate an export by selecting the version or export button.

section.title: Export
section.subtitle: As an Administrator or Content Manager
section.para: An Administrator or Content Manager can initiate an export by selecting the Export button in the Version and Export tab or selecting Export from the shortcuts menu. The workflow is the same as described in

section.title: Version
section.para:
When content is ready to be released, a Content Manager or Administrator can create a version by selecting the Create a Version located in the shortcuts menu or in the Export and Versions tab. A form will display, asking for the following information:
Module location - This is where the new version module will be located in the taxonomy after creation.
Version name – the user specified name of the version module.
Content version date - This optional field will update the content modification dates of the concepts to the date selected. If it is left blank, no changes will be made to the original dates on each concept.
Content range – Select the date range for the content you want to create a version for. To better assist you, you can optionally select the "Select by version date" link to pick a date based on a previous version.
Run Classifier – Gives the user the option to run the classifier as a step in generating a version.
Perform QA Test - QA tests are necessary to ensure accurate data. The version may not be created if there is a QA error. You can perform the test independently before creating a version or run it in this process. If you choose to run QA in this version creation and QA is unable to complete, the version will not be created.
Generate SCTIDs for content with missing IDs - If there are any SNOMED content with missing SCTIDs, the system can generate them for you. Include the namespace identifier provided by SNOMED international when this option is selected.
Namespace - If you choose to generate SCTIDs, this is the SNOMED identifier that is provided to you by SNOMED CT.
Create and download and export file - Downloads a compressed file of all of the contents.
Save a copy to the repository - Publishes the exported file into the repository server.
This is configurable for each customer and is not configured in the Knowledge demonstration enviornment.
Export Type
The Solor RF2 comptabible export will be supported in a future Knowledge release. – SNOMED CT RF2 is supported at this time.

mediaobject.alt: Create a Version modal displays a form with the following information: select modules, content range, perform QA test, perform classification, generate SCTIDs, namespace, export type, and buttons Create and Cancel.

section.para:
Select "Create Version" to begin the backend versioning process. A message is displayed to indicate the versioning process has started, see . The time to create a version will depend on the options selected, such as classification and QA.
Version Initiated

When version creation is complete the progress table is updated, see , and the results of create version are displayed, see .
Version or Export Progress

If Perform QA tests was selected and you wish to view the results select the Open QA Run link or if Run classifier was selected and you wish to view the classification results select the link Open Classifier run. You will be brought to either the QA or Classifier results depending on what was selected. If create and download an export file was selected the export file can be downloaded to the user's computer by selecting the Release file available link. In the Knowledge demonstration environment the export results will be available for a limited time and is not uploaded to a repository. In a production Knowledge environment the customer can choose to include uploading a version export to a repository. Version Results
